unnormalised: Environmental News: Wind Power Boost for Tamil Nadu Villages
normalised: environmental news: wind power boost for tamil nadu villages

unnormalised: Chennai, Oct 26 – Good news for rural Tamil Nadu! Several villages are set to receive a major renewable energy boost thanks to a new wind farm project near Madurai. Dr. Anjali Sharma, head of the project at IIT Madras, announced that the farm is projected to generate enough clean energy to power roughly 10,000 homes.
normalised: chennai, october twenty six – good news for rural tamil nadu! several villages are set to receive a major renewable energy boost thanks to a new wind farm project near madurai. doctor anjali sharma, head of the project at I I T madras, announced that the farm is projected to generate enough clean energy to power roughly ten thousand homes.

unnormalised: The project, funded by a consortium of investors including the Tata Group, utilizes cutting-edge turbine technology designed to withstand the region's unique wind patterns. The total land area occupied by the farm is about 50,000 sq ft.
normalised: the project, funded by a consortium of investors including the tata group, utilizes cutting-edge turbine technology designed to withstand the region's unique wind patterns. the total land area occupied by the farm is about fifty thousand square feet.

unnormalised: Residents like Kamala Amma expressed her delight, saying she looks forward to a more reliable electricity supply, particularly during the hot summer months. The project is expected to reduce carbon emissions by approximately 2,000 tonnes annually and will create local jobs. The estimated investment is Rs. 50 crores. The turbines are spaced 500 meters apart for optimal performance. Officials plan to expand the wind farm by an additional 20 sq km in the next phase.
normalised: residents like kamala amma expressed her delight, saying she looks forward to a more reliable electricity supply, particularly during the hot summer months. the project is expected to reduce carbon emissions by approximately two thousand tonnes annually and will create local jobs. the estimated investment is rupee fifty crore. the turbines are spaced five hundred meters apart for optimal performance. officials plan to expand the wind farm by an additional twenty square kilometer in the next phase.
